poem:
Title: "Ode to the Unbridled Joy"

In the heart of learning, a call stirs for play,
A revival of whimsy, to keep gloom at bay.
Crisis, like Plague, on young spirits weigh,
"Lightness, be their guide!" the campaigners say.
Health is more than the body, it's the soul's ballet,
A dance in the sun, a mindful melee.
Inspect this joy, Ofsted, hold our fears at bay,
In laughter and games, let them buffet.
